snippet.title: Memories create artistic incentive
snippet.content: INSIDE a timber box is a collection of coloured feathers - each a reminder of a life event. The memories belong to Caroline Magerl: a former child immigrant who lived aboard a yacht for 20 years and settled later in life on the Sunshine Coast. Now a popular local artist, Magerl has exhibited widely - most notably at Eva Breuer's Sydney Gallery and the Chris Beetles Gallery in St James, London. She will be showing new works at Buderim gallery Art Nuvo in her Box of Birds exhibition from August 12. The show explores the conversation between image and story. "This image was born out of a conversation I had with someone across a large table," she said. "Having reached an impasse, I saw in my mind's eye the figure hauling herself up an inclement mountain ... "It was a moment of private irony. "Images occur to me like little pieces of silent theatre. "I paint the players and eventually the pictures tell their stories. "Visual artists can be struck dumb when asked to explain their work with words. "However, I would propose that art is a journey worth taking on your own terms." Magerl recasts memory and events, with the help of her feather reminders, in this new series of works where people and animals flit through evocative backdrops, composed in a series of oils, watercolours and monograph prints. Box of Birds will be at Art Nuvo in Gloucester Rd, Buderim.
